decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing lands to control the game, with cards like Dark Depths, Thespian's Stage, and Crop Rotation to create powerful land-based combos. It also includes disruption cards like Wasteland and Grafdigger's Cage to hinder the opponent's strategies. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Mox Diamond and Exploration, while also utilizing Life from the Loam to recur key lands. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through careful land management and strategic plays.

The deck focuses on efficiently disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with evasive threats. It combines disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will with removal spells like Fatal Push and board presence from creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. The deck also utilizes card selection with Ponder and Brainstorm to ensure consistency in drawing threats and answers. The mana base is streamlined with dual lands like Underground Sea and fetch lands to enable the deck's color requirements and support Wasteland for resource denial.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board and continuously pressure the opponent with efficient creatures and removal spells. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Amped Raptor to quickly close out the game. The inclusion of Goblin Bombardment provides additional reach and synergy with the deck's creature-centric strategy. Overall, the Mardu Aggro deck aims to maintain a strong tempo and apply consistent pressure to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling a combo that aims to win the game in one explosive turn. By using powerful mana acceleration cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal, the deck is able to cast multiple spells in a single turn to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures like Narcomoeba and creatures or spells like Cabal Ritual and Cabal Therapy. Once the graveyard is full, the deck can use cards like Undercity Informer and Balustrade Spy to mill the entire library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle's enter-the-battlefield ability.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly and efficiently mill the entire library, allowing the player to win the game with Thassa's Oracle's "win the game" ability. The deck includes various ways to generate mana, discard cards from hand, and put creatures into play from the graveyard to facilitate the combo. The key strategy is to use a combination of acceleration and recursion to cast a critical mass of spells in the early turns, eventually leading to a game-winning sequence of plays involving Thassa's Oracle.

This deck aims to cheat big, powerful creatures into play quickly by using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier before they can effectively respond. Utilizing cards like Omniscience and Lotus Petal, the deck can generate a lot of mana to cast its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm. Overall, the deck focuses on getting its threats onto the battlefield as quickly as possible to outpace and overpower the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a high amount of mana and spells quickly in order to cast a large number of spells in a single turn, leading to a high storm count. This enables the player to win the game with a single devastating Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam. The deck includes various search and tutoring cards to find the necessary combo pieces, as well as disruption spells to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently and effectively execute a powerful storm combo to win the game.

The main focus of this UWx Control deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells and removal spells like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Prismatic Ending. The deck also includes card draw and selection with Ponder, Brainstorm, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. Various planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils provide additional control and card advantage. The deck aims to manage the opponent's threats while stabilizing the board and eventually winning the game through card advantage and control.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures. By utilizing disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, as well as removal spells like Fatal Push and Snuff Out, the deck aims to clear the way for threats like Barrowgoyf and Murktide Regent to end the game quickly. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and synergizes well with the rest of the deck. The mana base includes fetch lands and Wasteland to ensure consistency in casting spells and disrupting the opponent's mana base.

The main concept of this deck is to control the tempo of the game by utilizing disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will to counter opponent's plays, while also maintaining card advantage with Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Feed the Cycle. The deck also focuses on aggressive plays with efficient creatures like Brazen Borrower and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, supplemented by removal spells like Fatal Push. Additionally, the deck utilizes efficient land disruption with Wasteland to disrupt opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on utilizing Show and Tell to cheat out powerful creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield. It also includes cards like Omniscience and Sneak Attack to allow for explosive plays. The deck runs a high number of fetch lands and cantrips to ensure consistency in finding its combo pieces. It also includes disruptive cards like Force of Will and Veil of Summer to protect its combo. Overall, the key concept revolves around quickly and efficiently assembling game-winning combinations of cards.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's strategy while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Meddling Mage and Hullbreacher, you can control what your opponent can play while generating card advantage. Aether Vial allows you to cheat creatures into play, while cards like Solitude and Swords to Plowshares help you deal with threats efficiently. The deck is also built to take advantage of its companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, allowing you to flicker key creatures and gain incremental advantage over the course of the game.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The deck includes powerful creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Amped Raptor, supported by efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck is also equipped with cards like Guide of Souls and Voice of Victory to provide additional support and create a strong board presence. Additionally, cards like Ocelot Pride and Goblin Bombardment add extra layers of aggression to the deck, making it a formidable force in Legacy 1 vs 1 matchups.

The deck focuses on quickly getting out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier by using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. It also includes cards to protect and find these key combo pieces, such as Force of Will and Ponder. The lands in the deck allow for efficient mana production to support casting these big creatures early in the game. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and win the game before the opponent has a chance to respond.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Noble Hierarch and Gaea's Cradle, while utilizing creatures like Atraxa and Wight of the Reliquary for control and board presence. The deck also includes cards like Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith to search for key creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Collector Ouphe and Sylvan Safekeeper provides disruption and protection against opposing strategies. Overall, this deck aims to establish a strong mana base and control the game through powerful creature threats and disruptive spells.

This UR Aggro deck aims to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure to the opponent through efficient creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with countermagic and land destruction while also benefiting from card selection and graveyard synergies. Key cards such as Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent help to maintain pressure on the opponent while Lightning Bolt and other burn spells provide reach for closing out games. The deck's flexibility allows it to adapt to various matchups and control the pace of the game.
